intro: Helixyra cladostachya, commonly known as the clustered spike grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. It is native to specific regions in Africa and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
